intro: Apollonias sericea, commonly known as silverleaf apollonias, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, silver-gray leaves that are covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It produces small yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Apollonias sericea is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
